ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned about some great works from French authors and so many paintings!

You dont learn much about the history / historical context of the belle epoque outside of what comes up in the literature and art  that being said, the combination of literature, art, and museum visits creates a really interesting picture of belle epoque life
Learned quite a lot about the art and literature of the Belle Epoque. The course is friendly toward those without any previous knowledge of the subject matter

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: its really nice that you only have homework due once a week (you do all the reading for Tuesday, have an in class writing on Tuesday (20 mins) and then usually discuss art/finish discussing literature on Thursday). Also the class is well organized and most of it very interesting
strengths: amazing book selections and engaging lecturers

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! This course was so fun and taught me so much!

Yes! Absolutely come to Paris for the Belle Epoque program  the course is very interesting and the museum visits really allow you to experience Paris while learning more about the Belle Epoque. Workload isnt too heavy and program is so much fun!!

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I think this is a type of knowledge that becomes deeply ingrained in a person and inspires us for life. The works we got to see and read opened up our minds and likely changed us all for the better.

extras.title: FREN S369 01/HSAR S288 01/HUMS S214 01/LITR S247 01 - Belle Epoque France
